entry.title: NeurIPS Workshop accepted our paper for poster presentation

link.title: NeurIPS Workshop accepted our paper for poster presentation

entry.content:
We are pleased to announce our paper ‚ÄúGenerative Models in Protein Engineering: A Comprehensive Survey‚Äù has been accepted for poster presentation at the Foundation Models for Science Workshop at NeurIPS 2024.

Join us on December 14, 2024, in Vancouver, Canada, where we will present our comprehensive review of generative modeling approaches in protein engineering.
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce our paper ‚ÄúGenerative Models in Protein Engineering: A Comprehensive Survey‚Äù has been accepted for poster presentation at the Foundation Models for Science Workshop at NeurIPS 2024.

entry.title: Astrophysical Journal published our paper
entry.content:
We are pleased to announce our paper ‚ÄúVariable Stars in M31 Stellar Clusters from the Panchromatic Hubble Andromeda Treasury‚Äù has been published by the American Astronomical Society on October 17, 2024.

I am delighted to share a milestone in my research journey. A project I joined in June 2020, during my junior year of high school, has culminated in a publication in a premier astrophysical journal. This four-year journey has taught me firsthand that meaningful research requires persistence and patience. I am deeply grateful to my mentors, Dr. Monika D. Soraisam and Prof. Puragra Guhathakurta, for their invaluable guidance and support throughout this journey.
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce our paper ‚ÄúVariable Stars in M31 Stellar Clusters from the Panchromatic Hubble Andromeda Treasury‚Äù has been published by the American Astronomical Society on October 17, 2024.

entry.title: I am accepted into USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program

link.title: I am accepted into USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program

entry.summary: I am really happy about it.

entry.title: Just found this USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program! üéì

link.title: Just found this USC W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program! üéì

entry.content:
So, I stumbled upon something pretty cool at USC the other day - it‚Äôs called the W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program. After diving into their website and checking out what it‚Äôs all about, I‚Äôve been going back and forth about whether to throw my hat in the ring.

You know what? I think I‚Äôm gonna go for it! Even if I don‚Äôt end up completing the whole program (no pressure, right?), the extra courses look super interesting and could really come in handy for my future research dreams. I mean, why not level up my engineering game while I can? üöÄ

I‚Äôm actually getting kind of excited about this now! I‚Äôll keep you posted on how my application goes - fingers crossed! ü§û

Stay tuned for updates!
entry.summary: So, I stumbled upon something pretty cool at USC the other day - it‚Äôs called the W.V.T. Rusch Undergraduate Engineering Honors Program. After diving into their website and checking out what it‚Äôs all about, I‚Äôve been going back and forth about whether to throw my hat in the ring.

entry.title: Guess What? I Got into Northeastern‚Äôs Honors Program (with an $88K Scholarship!)

link.title: Guess What? I Got into Northeastern‚Äôs Honors Program (with an $88K Scholarship!)

entry.content: I am honored to be selected by the Northeastern University Admissions Committee for the prestigious Northeastern University Honors Scholarship. This merit-based award recognizes incoming students admitted to the Northeastern University Honors Program. The scholarship provides $22,000 for the first year, followed by $11,000 per semester in subsequent years, for a total award of up to $88,000 over the course of study.
entry.summary: I am honored to be selected by the Northeastern University Admissions Committee for the prestigious Northeastern University Honors Scholarship. This merit-based award recognizes incoming students admitted to the Northeastern University Honors Program. The scholarship provides $22,000 for the first year, followed by $11,000 per semester in subsequent years, for a total award of up to $88,000 over the course of study.
